AbsolutePathBuf.description:
A path that is guaranteed to be absolute and normalized (though it is not guaranteed to be canonicalized or exist on the filesystem).

IMPORTANT: When deserializing an `AbsolutePathBuf`, a base path must be set using [AbsolutePathBufGuard::new]. If no base path is set, the deserialization will fail unless the path being deserialized is already absolute.

AgentStatus.description: Agent lifecycle status, derived from emitted events.

oneOf.description: Agent is waiting for initialization.
Agent is currently running.
Agent is done. Contains the final assistant message.
oneOf.title: CompletedAgentStatus

oneOf.description: Agent encountered an error.
oneOf.title: ErroredAgentStatus

oneOf.description: Agent has been shutdown.
Agent is not found.

AppBranding.description: EXPERIMENTAL - app metadata returned by app-list APIs.

AppInfo.description: EXPERIMENTAL - app metadata returned by app-list APIs.

isEnabled.description: Whether this app is enabled in config.toml. Example: ```toml [apps.bad_app] enabled = false ```

AppListUpdatedNotification.description: EXPERIMENTAL - notification emitted when the app list changes.

AskForApproval.description: Determines the conditions under which the user is consulted to approve running the command proposed by Codex.

oneOf.description: Under this policy, only "known safe" commands—as determined by `is_safe_command()`—that **only read files** are auto‑approved. Everything else will ask the user to approve.

DEPRECATED: *All* commands are auto‑approved, but they are expected to run inside a sandbox where network access is disabled and writes are confined to a specific set of paths. If the command fails, it will be escalated to the user to approve execution without a sandbox. Prefer `OnRequest` for interactive runs or `Never` for non-interactive runs.
The model decides when to ask the user for approval.
Never ask the user to approve commands. Failures are immediately returned to the model, and never escalated to the user for approval.
OpenAI API key provided by the caller and stored by Codex.
ChatGPT OAuth managed by Codex (tokens persisted and refreshed by Codex).

[UNSTABLE] FOR OPENAI INTERNAL USE ONLY - DO NOT USE.

ChatGPT auth tokens are supplied by an external host app and are only stored in memory. Token refresh must be handled by the external host app.

end.description: End byte offset (exclusive) within the UTF-8 text buffer.

start.description: Start byte offset (inclusive) within the UTF-8 text buffer.

CallToolResult.description: The server's response to a tool call.

CodexErrorInfo.description:
This translation layer make sure that we expose codex error code in camel case.

When an upstream HTTP status is available (for example, from the Responses API or a provider), it is forwarded in `httpStatusCode` on the relevant `codexErrorInfo` variant.

oneOf.description: Failed to connect to the response SSE stream.
oneOf.title: ResponseStreamConnectionFailedCodexErrorInfo

oneOf.description: The response SSE stream disconnected in the middle of a turn before completion.
oneOf.title: ResponseStreamDisconnectedCodexErrorInfo

oneOf.description: Reached the retry limit for responses.
oneOf.title: ResponseTooManyFailedAttemptsCodexErrorInfo

CodexErrorInfo2.description: Codex errors that we expose to clients.

oneOf.description: Failed to connect to the response SSE stream.
oneOf.title: ResponseStreamConnectionFailedCodexErrorInfo2

oneOf.description: The response SSE stream disconnected in the middle of a turnbefore completion.
oneOf.title: ResponseStreamDisconnectedCodexErrorInfo2

oneOf.description: Reached the retry limit for responses.
oneOf.title: ResponseTooManyFailedAttemptsCodexErrorInfo2

details.description: Optional extra guidance or error details.

path.description: Optional path to the config file that triggered the warning.

range.description: Optional range for the error location inside the config file.

details.description: Optional extra guidance, such as migration steps or rationale.

summary.description: Concise summary of what is deprecated.

EventMsg.description: Response event from the agent NOTE: Make sure none of these values have optional types, as it will mess up the extension code-gen.

oneOf.description: Error while executing a submission
oneOf.title: ErrorEventMsg

oneOf.description: Warning issued while processing a submission. Unlike `Error`, this indicates the turn continued but the user should still be notified.
oneOf.title: WarningEventMsg

oneOf.description: Model routing changed from the requested model to a different model.
oneOf.title: ModelRerouteEventMsg

oneOf.description: Conversation history was compacted (either automatically or manually).
oneOf.title: ContextCompactedEventMsg

oneOf.description: Conversation history was rolled back by dropping the last N user turns.

num_turns.description: Number of user turns that were removed from context.

oneOf.title: ThreadRolledBackEventMsg

oneOf.description: Agent has started a turn. v1 wire format uses `task_started`; accept `turn_started` for v2 interop.
oneOf.title: TaskStartedEventMsg

oneOf.description: Agent has completed all actions. v1 wire format uses `task_complete`; accept `turn_complete` for v2 interop.
oneOf.title: TaskCompleteEventMsg

oneOf.description: Usage update for the current session, including totals and last turn. Optional means unknown — UIs should not display when `None`.
oneOf.title: TokenCountEventMsg

oneOf.description: Agent text output message
oneOf.title: AgentMessageEventMsg

oneOf.description: User/system input message (what was sent to the model)

images.description: Image URLs sourced from `UserInput::Image`. These are safe to replay in legacy UI history events and correspond to images sent to the model.

local_images.description: Local file paths sourced from `UserInput::LocalImage`. These are kept so the UI can reattach images when editing history, and should not be sent to the model or treated as API-ready URLs.

text_elements.description: UI-defined spans within `message` used to render or persist special elements.

oneOf.title: UserMessageEventMsg

oneOf.description: Agent text output delta message
oneOf.title: AgentMessageDeltaEventMsg

oneOf.description: Reasoning event from agent.
oneOf.title: AgentReasoningEventMsg

oneOf.description: Agent reasoning delta event from agent.
oneOf.title: AgentReasoningDeltaEventMsg

oneOf.description: Raw chain-of-thought from agent.
oneOf.title: AgentReasoningRawContentEventMsg

oneOf.description: Agent reasoning content delta event from agent.
oneOf.title: AgentReasoningRawContentDeltaEventMsg

oneOf.description: Signaled when the model begins a new reasoning summary section (e.g., a new titled block).
oneOf.title: AgentReasoningSectionBreakEventMsg

oneOf.description: Ack the client's configure message.

approval_policy.description: When to escalate for approval for execution

cwd.description: Working directory that should be treated as the *root* of the session.

history_entry_count.description: Current number of entries in the history log.

history_log_id.description: Identifier of the history log file (inode on Unix, 0 otherwise).

initial_messages.description: Optional initial messages (as events) for resumed sessions. When present, UIs can use these to seed the history.

model.description: Tell the client what model is being queried.

network_proxy.description: Runtime proxy bind addresses, when the managed proxy was started for this session.

reasoning_effort.description: The effort the model is putting into reasoning about the user's request.

rollout_path.description: Path in which the rollout is stored. Can be `None` for ephemeral threads

sandbox_policy.description: How to sandbox commands executed in the system

thread_name.description: Optional user-facing thread name (may be unset).

oneOf.title: SessionConfiguredEventMsg

oneOf.description: Updated session metadata (e.g., thread name changes).
oneOf.title: ThreadNameUpdatedEventMsg

oneOf.description: Incremental MCP startup progress updates.
oneOf.title: McpStartupUpdateEventMsg

oneOf.description: Aggregate MCP startup completion summary.
oneOf.title: McpStartupCompleteEventMsg

call_id.description: Identifier so this can be paired with the McpToolCallEnd event.
Identifier for the corresponding McpToolCallBegin that finished.

result.description: Result of the tool call. Note this could be an error.

oneOf.description: Notification that the server is about to execute a command.

call_id.description: Identifier so this can be paired with the ExecCommandEnd event.

cwd.description: The command's working directory if not the default cwd for the agent.

interaction_input.description: Raw input sent to a unified exec session (if this is an interaction event).

process_id.description: Identifier for the underlying PTY process (when available).

source.description: Where the command originated. Defaults to Agent for backward compatibility.

turn_id.description: Turn ID that this command belongs to.

oneOf.title: ExecCommandBeginEventMsg

oneOf.description: Incremental chunk of output from a running command.

call_id.description: Identifier for the ExecCommandBegin that produced this chunk.

chunk.description: Raw bytes from the stream (may not be valid UTF-8).

oneOf.title: ExecCommandOutputDeltaEventMsg

oneOf.description: Terminal interaction for an in-progress command (stdin sent and stdout observed).

call_id.description: Identifier for the ExecCommandBegin that produced this chunk.

process_id.description: Process id associated with the running command.

stdin.description: Stdin sent to the running session.

oneOf.title: TerminalInteractionEventMsg

call_id.description: Identifier for the ExecCommandBegin that finished.

cwd.description: The command's working directory if not the default cwd for the agent.

duration.description: The duration of the command execution.

formatted_output.description: Formatted output from the command, as seen by the model.

interaction_input.description: Raw input sent to a unified exec session (if this is an interaction event).

process_id.description: Identifier for the underlying PTY process (when available).

source.description: Where the command originated. Defaults to Agent for backward compatibility.

status.description: Completion status for this command execution.

turn_id.description: Turn ID that this command belongs to.

oneOf.description: Notification that the agent attached a local image via the view_image tool.

call_id.description: Identifier for the originating tool call.

path.description: Local filesystem path provided to the tool.

oneOf.title: ViewImageToolCallEventMsg

approval_id.description:
Identifier for this specific approval callback.

When absent, the approval is for the command item itself (`call_id`). This is present for subcommand approvals (via execve intercept).

call_id.description: Identifier for the associated command execution item.

network_approval_context.description: Optional network context for a blocked request that can be approved.

proposed_execpolicy_amendment.description: Proposed execpolicy amendment that can be applied to allow future runs.

reason.description: Optional human-readable reason for the approval (e.g. retry without sandbox).

turn_id.description: Turn ID that this command belongs to. Uses `#[serde(default)]` for backwards compatibility.

call_id.description: Responses API call id for the associated tool call, if available.

turn_id.description: Turn ID that this request belongs to. Uses `#[serde(default)]` for backwards compatibility.

call_id.description: Responses API call id for the associated patch apply call, if available.

grant_root.description: When set, the agent is asking the user to allow writes under this root for the remainder of the session.

reason.description: Optional explanatory reason (e.g. request for extra write access).

turn_id.description: Turn ID that this patch belongs to. Uses `#[serde(default)]` for backwards compatibility with older senders.

oneOf.description: Notification advising the user that something they are using has been deprecated and should be phased out.

details.description: Optional extra guidance, such as migration steps or rationale.

summary.description: Concise summary of what is deprecated.

oneOf.title: DeprecationNoticeEventMsg

oneOf.description: Notification that a model stream experienced an error or disconnect and the system is handling it (e.g., retrying with backoff).

additional_details.description: Optional details about the underlying stream failure (often the same human-readable message that is surfaced as the terminal error if retries are exhausted).

oneOf.title: StreamErrorEventMsg

oneOf.description: Notification that the agent is about to apply a code patch. Mirrors `ExecCommandBegin` so front‑ends can show progress indicators.

auto_approved.description: If true, there was no ApplyPatchApprovalRequest for this patch.

call_id.description: Identifier so this can be paired with the PatchApplyEnd event.

turn_id.description: Turn ID that this patch belongs to. Uses `#[serde(default)]` for backwards compatibility.

oneOf.title: PatchApplyBeginEventMsg

oneOf.description: Notification that a patch application has finished.

call_id.description: Identifier for the PatchApplyBegin that finished.

changes.description: The changes that were applied (mirrors PatchApplyBeginEvent::changes).

status.description: Completion status for this patch application.

stderr.description: Captured stderr (parser errors, IO failures, etc.).

success.description: Whether the patch was applied successfully.

turn_id.description: Turn ID that this patch belongs to. Uses `#[serde(default)]` for backwards compatibility.

oneOf.title: PatchApplyEndEventMsg

oneOf.description: Response to GetHistoryEntryRequest.

entry.description: The entry at the requested offset, if available and parseable.

oneOf.title: GetHistoryEntryResponseEventMsg

oneOf.description: List of MCP tools available to the agent.

auth_statuses.description: Authentication status for each configured MCP server.

resource_templates.description: Known resource templates grouped by server name.

resources.description: Known resources grouped by server name.

tools.description: Fully qualified tool name -> tool definition.

oneOf.title: McpListToolsResponseEventMsg

oneOf.description: List of custom prompts available to the agent.
oneOf.title: ListCustomPromptsResponseEventMsg

oneOf.description: List of skills available to the agent.
oneOf.title: ListSkillsResponseEventMsg

oneOf.description: List of remote skills available to the agent.
oneOf.title: ListRemoteSkillsResponseEventMsg

explanation.description: Arguments for the `update_plan` todo/checklist tool (not plan mode).

oneOf.description: Entered review mode.
oneOf.title: EnteredReviewModeEventMsg

oneOf.description: Exited review mode with an optional final result to apply.
oneOf.title: ExitedReviewModeEventMsg

oneOf.description: Collab interaction: agent spawn begin.

call_id.description: Identifier for the collab tool call.

prompt.description: Initial prompt sent to the agent. Can be empty to prevent CoT leaking at the beginning.

oneOf.title: CollabAgentSpawnBeginEventMsg

oneOf.description: Collab interaction: agent spawn end.

call_id.description: Identifier for the collab tool call.

new_thread_id.description: Thread ID of the newly spawned agent, if it was created.

prompt.description: Initial prompt sent to the agent. Can be empty to prevent CoT leaking at the beginning.

status.description: Last known status of the new agent reported to the sender agent.

oneOf.description: Collab interaction: agent interaction begin.

call_id.description: Identifier for the collab tool call.

prompt.description: Prompt sent from the sender to the receiver. Can be empty to prevent CoT leaking at the beginning.

call_id.description: Identifier for the collab tool call.

prompt.description: Prompt sent from the sender to the receiver. Can be empty to prevent CoT leaking at the beginning.

status.description: Last known status of the receiver agent reported to the sender agent.

oneOf.description: Collab interaction: waiting begin.

call_id.description: ID of the waiting call.

oneOf.description: Collab interaction: waiting end.

call_id.description: ID of the waiting call.

statuses.description: Last known status of the receiver agents reported to the sender agent.

call_id.description: Identifier for the collab tool call.

FunctionCallOutputContentItem.description: Responses API compatible content items that can be returned by a tool call. This is a subset of ContentItem with the types we support as function call outputs.

FunctionCallOutputPayload.description:
The payload we send back to OpenAI when reporting a tool call result.

`body` serializes directly as the wire value for `function_call_output.output`. `success` remains internal metadata for downstream handling.

GhostCommit.description: Details of a ghost commit created from a repository state.

server.description: Name of the MCP server as defined in the config.

tool.description: Name of the tool as given by the MCP server.

MessagePhase2.description:
Classifies an assistant message as interim commentary or final answer text.

Providers do not emit this consistently, so callers must treat `None` as "phase unknown" and keep compatibility behavior for legacy models.

oneOf.description:
Mid-turn assistant text (for example preamble/progress narration).

Additional tool calls or assistant output may follow before turn completion.
The assistant's terminal answer text for the current turn.

ModeKind.description: Initial collaboration mode to use when the TUI starts.

NetworkAccess.description: Represents whether outbound network access is available to the agent.

path.description: (Best effort) Path to the file being read by the command. When possible, this is an absolute path, though when relative, it should be resolved against the `cwd`` that will be used to run the command to derive the absolute path.

PlanDeltaNotification.description: EXPERIMENTAL - proposed plan streaming deltas for plan items. Clients should not assume concatenated deltas match the completed plan item content.

resets_at.description: Unix timestamp (seconds since epoch) when the window resets.

used_percent.description: Percentage (0-100) of the window that has been consumed.

ReadOnlyAccess.description: Determines how read-only file access is granted inside a restricted sandbox.

oneOf.description:
Restrict reads to an explicit set of roots.

When `include_platform_defaults` is `true`, platform defaults required for basic execution are included in addition to `readable_roots`.

include_platform_defaults.description: Include built-in platform read roots required for basic process execution.

readable_roots.description: Additional absolute roots that should be readable.

oneOf.title: RestrictedReadOnlyAccess

oneOf.description: Allow unrestricted file reads.
oneOf.title: FullAccessReadOnlyAccess

RequestId.description: ID of a request, which can be either a string or an integer.

Resource.description: A known resource that the server is capable of reading.

ResourceTemplate.description: A template description for resources available on the server.

call_id.description: Set when using the Responses API.

id.description: Legacy id field retained for compatibility with older payloads.

ReviewCodeLocation.description: Location of the code related to a review finding.

ReviewFinding.description: A single review finding describing an observed issue or recommendation.

ReviewLineRange.description: Inclusive line range in a file associated with the finding.

ReviewOutputEvent.description: Structured review result produced by a child review session.

oneOf.description: Review the working tree: staged, unstaged, and untracked files.
oneOf.title: UncommittedChangesReviewTarget

oneOf.description: Review changes between the current branch and the given base branch.
oneOf.title: BaseBranchReviewTarget

oneOf.description: Review the changes introduced by a specific commit.

title.description: Optional human-readable label (e.g., commit subject) for UIs.

oneOf.title: CommitReviewTarget

oneOf.description: Arbitrary instructions provided by the user.
oneOf.title: CustomReviewTarget

SandboxPolicy.description: Determines execution restrictions for model shell commands.

oneOf.description: No restrictions whatsoever. Use with caution.
oneOf.title: DangerFullAccessSandboxPolicy

oneOf.description: Read-only access configuration.

access.description: Read access granted while running under this policy.

oneOf.title: ReadOnlySandboxPolicy

oneOf.description: Indicates the process is already in an external sandbox. Allows full disk access while honoring the provided network setting.

network_access.description: Whether the external sandbox permits outbound network traffic.

oneOf.title: ExternalSandboxSandboxPolicy

oneOf.description: Same as `ReadOnly` but additionally grants write access to the current working directory ("workspace").

exclude_slash_tmp.description: When set to `true`, will NOT include the `/tmp` among the default writable roots on UNIX. Defaults to `false`.

exclude_tmpdir_env_var.description: When set to `true`, will NOT include the per-user `TMPDIR` environment variable among the default writable roots. Defaults to `false`.

network_access.description: When set to `true`, outbound network access is allowed. `false` by default.

read_only_access.description: Read access granted while running under this policy.

writable_roots.description: Additional folders (beyond cwd and possibly TMPDIR) that should be writable from within the sandbox.

oneOf.title: WorkspaceWriteSandboxPolicy

short_description.description: Legacy short_description from SKILL.md. Prefer SKILL.json interface.short_description.

byteRange.description: Byte range in the parent `text` buffer that this element occupies.

placeholder.description: Optional human-readable placeholder for the element, displayed in the UI.

byte_range.description: Byte range in the parent `text` buffer that this element occupies.

placeholder.description: Optional human-readable placeholder for the element, displayed in the UI.

cliVersion.description: Version of the CLI that created the thread.

createdAt.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the thread was created.

cwd.description: Working directory captured for the thread.

gitInfo.description: Optional Git metadata captured when the thread was created.

modelProvider.description: Model provider used for this thread (for example, 'openai').

path.description: [UNSTABLE] Path to the thread on disk.

preview.description: Usually the first user message in the thread, if available.

source.description: Origin of the thread (CLI, VSCode, codex exec, codex app-server, etc.).

status.description: Current runtime status for the thread.

turns.description: Only populated on `thread/resume`, `thread/rollback`, `thread/fork`, and `thread/read` (when `includeTurns` is true) responses. For all other responses and notifications returning a Thread, the turns field will be an empty list.

updatedAt.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the thread was last updated.

oneOf.description: EXPERIMENTAL - proposed plan item content. The completed plan item is authoritative and may not match the concatenation of `PlanDelta` text.
oneOf.title: PlanThreadItem

aggregatedOutput.description: The command's output, aggregated from stdout and stderr.

commandActions.description: A best-effort parsing of the command to understand the action(s) it will perform. This returns a list of CommandAction objects because a single shell command may be composed of many commands piped together.

durationMs.description: The duration of the command execution in milliseconds.

processId.description: Identifier for the underlying PTY process (when available).

durationMs.description: The duration of the MCP tool call in milliseconds.

agentsStates.description: Last known status of the target agents, when available.

id.description: Unique identifier for this collab tool call.

prompt.description: Prompt text sent as part of the collab tool call, when available.

receiverThreadIds.description: Thread ID of the receiving agent, when applicable. In case of spawn operation, this corresponds to the newly spawned agent.

senderThreadId.description: Thread ID of the agent issuing the collab request.

status.description: Current status of the collab tool call.

tool.description: Name of the collab tool that was invoked.

Tool.description: Definition for a tool the client can call.

error.description: Only populated when the Turn's status is failed.

items.description: Only populated on a `thread/resume` or `thread/fork` response. For all other responses and notifications returning a Turn, the items field will be an empty list.

TurnDiffUpdatedNotification.description: Notification that the turn-level unified diff has changed. Contains the latest aggregated diff across all file changes in the turn.

oneOf.description:
Assistant-authored message payload used in turn-item streams.

`phase` is optional because not all providers/models emit it. Consumers should use it when present, but retain legacy completion semantics when it is `None`.

phase.description:
Optional phase metadata carried through from `ResponseItem::Message`.

This is currently used by TUI rendering to distinguish mid-turn commentary from a final answer and avoid status-indicator jitter.

oneOf.title: AgentMessageTurnItem

text_elements.description: UI-defined spans within `text` used to render or persist special elements.

UI-defined spans within `text` that should be treated as special elements. These are byte ranges into the UTF-8 `text` buffer and are used to render or persist rich input markers (e.g., image placeholders) across history and resume without mutating the literal text.

oneOf.description: Pre‑encoded data: URI image.
oneOf.title: ImageUserInput2

oneOf.description: Local image path provided by the user.  This will be converted to an `Image` variant (base64 data URL) during request serialization.
oneOf.title: LocalImageUserInput2

oneOf.description: Skill selected by the user (name + path to SKILL.md).
oneOf.title: SkillUserInput2

oneOf.description: Explicit mention selected by the user (name + app://connector id).
oneOf.title: MentionUserInput2

description: Notification sent from the server to the client.

oneOf.description: NEW NOTIFICATIONS
oneOf.title: ErrorNotification

oneOf.description: This event is internal-only. Used by Codex Cloud.
oneOf.title: RawResponseItem/completedNotification

oneOf.description: EXPERIMENTAL - proposed plan streaming deltas for plan items.
oneOf.title: Item/plan/deltaNotification

oneOf.description: Deprecated: Use `ContextCompaction` item type instead.
oneOf.title: Thread/compactedNotification

oneOf.description: Notifies the user of world-writable directories on Windows, which cannot be protected by the sandbox.
oneOf.title: Windows/worldWritableWarningNotification

oneOf.description: DEPRECATED NOTIFICATIONS below
oneOf.title: AuthStatusChangeNotification

oneOf.description: Deprecated: use `account/login/completed` instead.
oneOf.title: LoginChatGptCompleteNotification

title: ServerNotification
